Job Details:
DATA SCIENTIST
LovelyStay is one of the largest property managers in Portugal. Our focus is on delighting guests and property owners. In 5 years alone  weve grown into a vibrant  multilingual team and  strive to make sure our guests and owners feel the same through their experience with us. Bright  ambitious and dedicated individuals are always welcome :) Get involved  come join us!
What are we looking for?
A proactive  experienced  goal-oriented Data Scientist  keen on delivering an excellent service.
About the position
The role will require you to deal with data by developing tools and working closely with the internal team to complete overall business requirements. There will be a large focus on creating and managing packages and scripts to perform data manipulation and validation. This is a key role within the heart of the business and will allow you to be involved with everyday functioning as well as analysing the past and planning the future.

What will you do?
Collect  process and clean and analyse data from disparate sources within a data-driven team  using SQL  Python or other scripting and statistical tools
Work together with other departments as a team to develop solutions for important business problems  using common and/or self-built tools to support important business decisions
Participate in design  implementation and analysis of new and existing features
Analyse short term rental (STR) market data to provide insight to company stakeholders
Use STR market data to work in close contact with Revenue Management team to improve existing pricing algorithm
Prepare and present data insights in an accessible way to colleagues and other stakeholders
About you
Have a solid background in Mathematics/Statistics or Computer Science. A good balance of both will be valued.
Develop well-designed  reusable  testable and performant code using scalable techniques  mainly in the scope of data handling and analysis
Have experience using relational databases (PostgreSQL will be valued) to extract and manipulate data
Know how to interpret and present data visually providing relevant insights; write and deliver engaging presentations
Enjoy transforming complex information into clear recommendations.
Are highly motivated to solve complex problems in close collaboration with others
Are goal oriented  self-starter eager to achieve real business effects
Have full professional proficiency in written and spoken English
We offer:
Competitive package  Meal Allowance Card  Health Insurance
Laptop and Mobile  Transport Expenses
Company Events  Friendly Environment
Flexible work policy: Full Remote working  in the Office or a Mix  as you prefer!
Join us!
Please send your CV to HR  with the reference DS_01.2022 to our Head of HR  Sofia Sequeira through the mail hr@lovelystay.com The chosen profiles will be contacted shortly.

Requisitos:
- Formao em reas como Cincia dos Computadores  Matemtica ou Cincias mas com fortes conhecimentos tecnolgicos.
- Excelente conhecimento de modelos de ML e respectivos algoritmos e todas as suas aplicaes
- Conhecimentos de BigData
- Conhecimentos de Python
- Domnio de estatstica e visualizao de dados
- Bons conhecimentos de algoritmos relacionados com retalho so bem-vindos.

Descrio das tarefas:
- Construir modelos avanados para classificao de objectos  previso de comportamentos ou criao de recomendaes.
- Usar estatstica  algoritmos  recolha de dados e tcnicas de visualizao para a modelao de problemas complexos 
- Encontrar oportunidades de crescimento  encontrar solues e entregar aces / direces concretas de forma a fazer evoluir os negcios ( Vantagem competitiva ).
- Ser responsvel pelos projetos a si entregues e usar esta autonomia para encontrar solues criativas de resoluo
- Ser capaz de explicar  de forma verbal  escrita e usando ferramentas de visualizao de dados o projeto  os passos dados e toda a evoluo construda aos colegas  equipa e tambm aos clientes finais.

Job Description
Are you looking for a challenging opportunity with a lot of variety  in a shifting environment? Then this opportunity is right for you!
Bose is an international Company with thousands of employees  customers and suppliers worldwide  which means that we deal with foreign cultures  languages and people and this makes our work diverse and challenging.
Global Business Services (GBS) develops  maintains and implements standardized transactional processes across Bose  to be delivered from our Lisbon  Portugal Business Services Center (BSC) and supported across other Bose offices worldwide. By closely aligning with internal customers and by partnering with the BSC  GBS manages the delivery of services to achieve our internal business needs by driving efficiencies and effectiveness.
We are currently recruiting an Accounting Data Analyst to join our Data Process & Support team  fluent in English. We need an equally passionate Analyst with skills developing data governance methodologies  who likes working in a collaborative Agile team environment.


You Will
75% Accounting Data Stewardship:
 Maintain accurate master data for the Accounting Data Domain (general ledger accounts  cost centers  profit centers  internal orders  BlackLine system data)
 Create and monitor data quality reports for accounting master data
 Partner with key finance stakeholders to drive improvement initiatives on data quality and upstream processes
 Establish and run the Accounting Data Governance Council to gain insight into data issues across businesses and regions

25% Accounting Process Optimization:
 Complete monthly reporting and analysis of KPIs and work with stakeholders to drive improvement initiatives
 Partner with the Account to Report Delivery Team and key stakeholders to identify  manage  and drive standardization of processes with an agile approach
 Help facilitate the transition of work from individual countries to the Business Service Center in Lisbon
 Work with the Account to Report Delivery Team and Bose Technical Teams to evaluate and implement process automation opportunities
 Create and maintain standard process documentation to assist in current state and future state discussions


What you'll need to succeed
We Are Looking For People With
 2+ years of experience in an accounting or finance related role
 Strong technical aptitude working within an ERP environment - SAP required - and working with Business Intelligence tools
 Microsoft SQL
 Fluency in English  additional European language a plus
 Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing to key stakeholders and senior leaders
 Ability to work independently and drive change
 Detail oriented  professional attitude  reliable


You may also have these skills but if not  we will happily teach you:
 Collibra
 Winshuttle
 Process Automation Tools
 Shared Services environment or a multinational company
 Lean Management (or other process improvement methodologies)


Are you interested?
We are looking forward to your application! Upload CV in English via the Apply button above.
For further information about the internship please contact us via Careers_Portugal@bose.com


Office Location: Avenida Defensores de Chaves  45  Lisboa  1000-112

As a Data Analyst  you will need analytical and problem solving skills as well as programming experience to be able to analyse large data sets of information with the appropriate tools and techniques.
In this role you will be part of customer's Business Platforms Insights Division  providing information for the process of delivering insight and innovation through data  analytics  engagement and consultancy services to insurers and/or reinsurers  across the full spectrum of insurance  reinsurance  and capital markets.
You will use our customer's suite of analytical tools (Alteryx  Tableau  PowerBI etc.) supported by the actual data warehouse platforms (MS SQL Server  AWS  Redshift etc.).

You will:
Support other analysts through the implementation of best practices of analytics  through knowledge sharing  through mentoring and formal training.
Become an expert in new technologies that are introduced by upskilling through focused training and self-learning.
Participate in and contribute to our Data Analyst Chapter forums and activities.
Design  develop  test  tune  deploy data pipeline solutions and hand off to support teams to operate
Maintain up to date Technical and Operational documentation
Manage task list and communicate updates to stakeholders and team members following an Agile Scrum methodology
Work as key member of the core team to support the timely and efficient delivery of critical data integration deliverables

Requirements:
Minimum of 3 years experience working a high performing team with a focus on service delivery to a broad range of global  diverse customers across different levels and time / geographic regions.
Demonstrate expertise in analytics and data insights using tools such as Alteryx  Tableau  PowerBI  Trifacta  Talend  etc.
Experience in databases such as AWS  SQL Server  Redshift etc.
Fluent in English
Must be a portuguese citizen or have a work permit for Portugal OR
Must be a spanish citizen or have a work permit for Spain

Experience in following is a plus:
Financial or professional services industry experience (insurance  wholesale banking  retail banking  consultancy)
Degree in IT or Data Science qualification with high analytical content (such as data analytics / statistics / computer science) would be desirable
Post-graduate qualifications (in related disciplines) would be advantageous
Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM
Fluency in Portuguese  Spanish or French is a plus

Soft Skills
Commitment: You should be committed to the project  vision  team and the business.
The Power of No: Many times  you will have to say no to the business and not develop every single idea that the business can think of.
Vision: Clearly communicate the vision between the small backlog items and the larger business goal. Ability to understand the bigger picture and go deep in functional/technical details
Curiosity: You should always be curious to ask the Why questions from the business and how from the development team

What we offer
We offer a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data  Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects  you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path.
Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data  digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better  making data matter.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst  you will be a valued member of the companys Data Analytics team whose main role is developing BI solutions as well as providing data analysis service to various internal stakeholders (Sales  Product Development  Finance  Customer Support  Risks  Engineering etc.).

Main Duties & Responsibilities:
Support internal stakeholders with appropriate data analysis and help them to make really data driven decisions
Work closely with internal stakeholders and  where it is possible - automate analytics by building new dashboards and reports in Business Intelligence tools
Improve existing dashboards  reports  and data transformations
Present data and findings in clear  easy to digest way

Requirements:
University degree preferably in computer sciences  mathematics  or other exact sciences
At least 3 years experience in data analysis and building content in some BI tool (Tableau  Qlik  Power BI  or similar)
Ability to demonstrate creative thinking and passion about data and data analysis
Ability to be careful and thorough about details
Experience in writing queries in SQL
Willingness to acquire additional technical skills where it can help to make work more efficient
Ability to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing

Nice to have skills:
Knowledge of scripting/programming languages (e.g.  Python)
Previous experience in work with large amounts of data

We offer:
Competitive remuneration package
Dynamic work in successful  growing  international company
Possibility to work with really Big Data and various tools and technologies (Tableau  Hadoop / Hive / Hue  MS SQL  PostgreSQL  Yandex ClickHouse  Apache Superset  Qlik Sense  Python  GitLab  Jenkins  etc.)
Friendly  helpful colleagues

Does the world of data inspire you?

Do you want to develop new skills  contributing to a wide variety of projects in an environment that values technical excellence and collaborative working?

We believe that every dataset tells a story and we're looking for data enthusiasts with experience in data analysis and visualisation to join our rapidly expanding Data and AI practice.

About Us
We're an innovative tech consultancy - a team of problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

We bring together experts from diverse backgrounds and experiences in a collaborative and open culture to deliver outstanding outcomes for our clients  and a stimulating and rewarding environment for our people.

We're helping some of the world's largest organisations to build cloud-native data platforms. If you have experience with data exploration  profiling  analysis  modelling  pattern recognition or data visualisation  we'd love to talk to you.

About the Role
In Data at BJSS you'll join multi-disciplinary teams of some of the brightest and best in the industry. You'll work in a fast moving  agile environment building data models and ontologies  and analysing and profiling datasets. You'll design ETL processes and services and create powerful dashboards to bring data insights to life.

You'll help us deliver some of the most exciting digital programmes around  for clients in a range of industries by:
Applying cross-disciplinary thinking and working collaboratively with other members of your team
Building a deep understanding of business domain and user needs and ensuring business value is unlocked as early as possible
Thinking holistically and treating data as a business service
Designing BI as centre of excellence for business data

About You
We're looking for people who will go an extra mile to understand our clients' strategic and operational challenges and help us to design and deliver innovative solutions.
You'll have worked with:
ETL tools or have experience profiling and cleaning the data. Preferably with Pandas or SQL
Data visualisation tools. Primarily Power BI  Tableau or Qlik
DB model design tools  like Erwin  and know different modelling techniques (Kimball  Inmon  )

Experience with AWS or Azure would be helpful.

Above all you'll be passionate about unlocking the power of data to deliver business value.

BJSS is committed to equal opportunities and diversity so we want to ensure that our recruitment and selection processes are fair to all who wish to apply.
We encourage you to feel confident to let us know if you require any adjustments to be made to the application or interview process to help support you. You can do this by speaking to your BJSS recruitment contact.

NA 1.1 Technology & Profile Data strategy - value targeting Value targeting analyst
1.2 Seniority 5/7 years
1.3 Hard and soft skills requested Looking to recruit 2 resources In order to be successful in this role  the Value Targeting Analyst will work closely with the Data Strategy Manager and Digital Leads.

Of this role is to work in an entrepreneurial fashion in order to help generate hypotheses  conduct initial analysis and hypothesis evaluation  and work with the team to develop value and prioritise the use cases / hypothesis.
Criteria for advancement includes expanded skills and knowledge based on experience  record of success (key KPIs to be defined)  and job assignments.
Key responsibilities include (not exhaustive) Coordinates activities to drive the opportunity / hypothesis identification  development of business cases for each hypothesis and refinement of value generation. Documentation of hypothesis generation for identification of cost reduction and revenue growth opportunities using industry  market  functional area  & organization expertise. Active management of the value map / use cases across the various functions engaging with key stakeholders as required  ensuring its adequate prioritisation Develops and delivers written and verbal presentations  briefings  and other communications in a compelling  visually driven  concise and informative manner. Supports Strategy team and participates in various ad hoc projects on an as needed basis. Other duties as assigned. Active role building the value targeting approaches and methodologies to set up the team for success Experience & Education Minimum of 5 / 7 years of experience including 1 /2 years in value targeting roles. Past experience in consulting environment - management consulting or IT strategy with a focus on analytics Proven experience working in uncertain and challenging environments Functional knowledge / experience of key domains (operations  customer journey  employee journey) Ability to communicate and influence senior stakeholders at varying organisational levels & functional areas Ability to articulate business requirements to technical resources and vice versa. Knowledge of manufacturing industry (not essential) Strong oral and written communication skills. Master's degree in management  information technology  or a related field Skills Result orientation  influence & impact Empowerment & accountability Team spirit  building relationships  collective accountability Strong leadership capability  executing as appropriate in the areas of responsibility.



Context of the mission :

The client initiated a profound transformation earlier this year and this transformation positioned digital technologies as key drivers to make it happen. It requires us to change the way we operate  to maximize value across the organization  and adapt to a faster pace of change while ensuring business continuity. We are now building our new Digital-Technology organisation  developing our skills and competencies to reinvent progress and to create together sustainable shared value for all. Be part of our transformation and drive the change as a member of our future team. We are ONE team that holds accountability as a key standard in our relentless pursuit to deliver value for our customers and stakeholders. In our agile and collaborative work environment we have fun to continue living our motto: reinvent progress. Within our Data  Analytics & AI Platform we are setting up our value targeting capability. This team will be critical to performing business diagnostic and analytical techniques to assist organizations in identifying  validating  and prioritizing value creation opportunities and successfully delivery the transformation journey. We are looking for 2 Value Targeting Analyst to join the team The Value Targeting Analyst will be responsible for drive the value targeting activities working across a variety of functional areas (e.g. Operations  Employee Journey  Customer Journey  Research). The role will involve leveraging data analytics  functional area expertise  and stakeholder input to help identify opportunities to value capture and deliver the client strategy and ambition

Role Overview

As part of our product operations team  your role would be crucial in ensuring the business runs at peak performance and in an efficient manner. As we continue to expand globally; our goal is to have a team who are capable of getting the most out of our internal data and creating high level business intelligent streams. As a dedicated Data Analyst for the Product Operations team  you will be responsible for supporting a range of initiatives for teams across the organisation. Your daily work will impact how we service our customers  how we track effectiveness of internal processes or launch new products in new markets. You will design key metrics to measure different aspect of our business  build automated reports for a range internal stakeholders and create dashboards to visualise insights for senior management. The insights generated from your datasets will be shared and used by the rest of the company as we grow globally.

About Uncapped ??

Founded in 2019  Uncapped is the fastest  most affordable way for growing online businesses to fund marketing and inventory. The company was born out of frustration with the limited financing options available for UK and European entrepreneurs to finance growth.
Uncapped provides business advances of between 10K and 5M without credit checks  personal guarantees  warrants  equity  or compounding interest -- and makes money by charging a low flat fee that is paid back from future sales revenue.
Uncapped has raised $120 million from investors including Lakestar  Mouro Capital  Global Founders Capital  White Star Capital  Seedcamp  and All Iron Ventures.

High proficiency in SQL

Used to AGILE ways of working (Kanban  Scrum)
Product-minded  always thinking of how their actions will ultimately impact the customer
Takes initiative and is adaptive and flexible

About The Role

Business need

A Data and Reporting Analyst within CE Ops Data team to partner with the Ops teams with a focus on building visualizations and dashboards to provide better insights.

In 2022  there is a need to build reporting across teams with a focus on Performance management  WFM  QA and Content teams. Individual data analysts will also work on reporting needs of service functions. Reporting analysts should be able to build frameworks and larger teams can leverage the same.

Summary

The Reporting/Data Visualization Analyst will work closely with our business and technical teams under the Reporting & Analytics Operations team to deliver reporting solutions. The aim is to provide accurate and high-quality data visualizations and analyses to the CE organization. With this analysis  Kraken can further its mission by making better data-driven decisions. The Reporting/Data Visualization Analyst should possess a strong understanding of data and how best to convey it to a wide range of audiences.

Responsibilities

Assist in reporting requirements design  reporting development  data validation
Design  develop  and deploy ETL processes using SQL (Superset)
Transforming data sets  quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals
Creating and editing visual content including maps  charts  and graphs
Provide Business Intelligence solutions including datasets  analytics  dashboards  and reports to support Kraken CE team in making informed decisions that increase the bottom line through improved quality and services
Typical assignments encompass working with business analysts and the wider organization to clarify requirements  estimating efforts  writing queries  analyzing data  and developing visualizations
Facilitate data-driven decisions by communicating results and findings in a clear and concise manner

Qualifications - Tools And Domain Knowledge

A degree in computer science  information systems  analytics  a related field of study  or relevant work experience
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data visualization and building reporting/dashboards
Experience in BI and Analytics best practices  requirements gathering  data modeling  in-depth data analysis
Expertise with BI tools including reporting and data visualization platforms (example - Mix panel  Tableau  Power BI  Yellowfin  Looker  or equivalent tools)
Intermediate to Advanced SQL  data querying skills necessary to query and analyze data
Python skills are a plus but not necessary

Skills And Abilities

Understanding of data and the role it plays in a modern organization
Knowledge of relational and non-relational database storage management systems  including Big Data platforms  preferred
Develop data-driven solutions and strategies to organizational challenges
Strong data visualization skills
Complex problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong written and verbal communication
Accountable; takes ownership and pride in their work
Ability to work independently on multiple engagements  communicate and provide timely updates
Natural curiosity with a strong desire to learn  maintain  and apply knowledge of emerging BI&A tools  strategy  methodology  and general best practices  preferred

About Us

At Cloudflare  we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the worlds largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties  for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware  installing software  or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network  which gets smarter with every request. As a result  they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazines Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the Worlds Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills  and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About The Department

You'll be a part of the Cloudflare Radar and Data Insights Lisbon Engineering team. This team will be working on data-driven projects  launching new products and functionalities  and exploring emerging technologies. We operate with small groups of highly motivated and experienced software engineers and data scientists who like to solve problems. We work to meet both the challenges of a massively growing customer base and our internal company needs.

https://radar.cloudflare.com/

What You'll Do

Cloudflare is looking for a Data Analyst to help us explore our data  and produce studies and reports for internal teams and Cloudflare Radar. This role will also entail statistical analysis  validating data sources  storytelling and participation in other data analysis initiatives. The Data Analyst will be working with the team and focusing on exploring and contributing to answer data questions and find insights for our products. This team will also be doing a fair amount of exploration of new ideas  where motivation  innovation  and creative thinking will be essential.

Desirable Skills  Knowledge And Experience
Experience in data processing using SQL (BigQuery  Clickhouse  PostgreSQL are some of the databases we use)
Strong experience in scientific computing using Python  R  Scala  or equivalent (Python and its scientific stack is a strong favourite)
Experience in using Jupyter Notebooks or similar
Proven ability to define and spot macro and micro level trends with statistical significance on a regular basis and understand key drivers driving those trends
Strong data analytical and data visualization skills  taking initiative in deriving data insights and performing analysis to assess data quality
Experience in working with structured  unstructured  and semi-structured data
Demonstrated ability to work in a team
Nice to have:
Technical education background
Work experience in the field


What Makes Cloudflare Special?

Were not just a highly ambitious  large-scale technology company. Were a highly ambitious  large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work  technology already used by Cloudflares enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free  so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016  we have partnered with Path Forward  a nonprofit organization  to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child  parent  or loved one.

1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster  more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Heres the deal - we dont store client IP addresses never  ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something youd like to be a part of? Wed love to hear from you!

The team named STFS  for Stress Testing and Financial Synthesis  coordinates the strengthening of the Bankss Stress-Testing (S/T) and planning capabilities so as to better serve Business Lines  Legal Entities and Group needs and meet supervisory requirement on these matters  and in a cost-efficient manner.
To that effect  STFS aims at building a flexible  industrialized  central utility accessible by the Banks Business Lines and Entities (B/E) for their local needs and their contribution to Group exercises. STFS offers an integrated S/T service to B/Es to support them in capitalizing on the shared framework for their local needs.
STFS is also responsible for executing all Group-wide  comprehensive stress testing exercises  whether regulatory or internal
The Transversal STMM (Stress Testing Methods and Methodologies) team is in charge of implementing the holistic approach to stress testing  dealing with interactions between the various components  defining shared practices  and coordinating transversal works. The transversal team will be strongly involved in the RISK Anticipation governance  and work closely with other teams of STFS  gathering the full view on model roadmap and capabilities  in the implementation of the stress testing target operating model. The team focuses on market  operational  securitization and CCP risks leading transversal topics such as the review of the Internal Capital calculation and the implementation of a comprehensive Reverse Stress Test methodology.

ROLE AND RESPONSABILITIES
Monitoring STFS and Group for questions about Stress Test models and calculation engines that you have developed
Be a pilot in the development of the Python library on Stress Test models using Machine Learning / artificial intelligence. This involves building the architecture of the new library module in collaboration with the team members in Lisbon and Paris
Understanding and managing risks figures based on Bank internal Risk and FO tools
Bring innovative approaches to find solutions
Contribute to the definition of Stress Test models on different perimeters (Market  Operational Risk  Credit  Liquidity  etc.) by specific studies
Documenting key procedures and controls
Carrying out any other task associated with the role as reasonably requested.
The candidate will be reporting to the head of STFS Lisbon team.
PROFILE
 Minimum of 2 to 5 years of successful experience in Market Risk or Front Office quantitative role
 Strong academic background  with at minimum a Master degree in applied Mathematics  Engineer  Sciences
 Knowledge in financial modelling with successful experience in Market environment (FO Quantitative Analyst  Market Risk Management  Market Model Validation  )
 Strong background in programming with ability to code in Python  C# and use of external packages.
 Knowledge of BCBS regulations  CRDIV/CRR  EBA Guidelines  FRTB. Understanding of Management control principles would be much appreciated
 Languages: English fluent

Kick-start your career in the online gaming world and experience the very latest in technology and innovation.

The Department

Want to be part of a team thats pioneering in our industry? Then look no further. Our mission is to unlock the power of our data by finding innovative ways to analyse  organise  integrate and visualise information.

By doing this we empower leaders across the business to make decisions quickly and confidently. Youll have access to cutting edge technologies and techniques and be part of a wider team of high performing analysts  datascientists  product managers and marketers.

Excited by the power of data? You could be just who we want on our team.

Purpose Of The Role

This role will be centred around providing reporting and insights for the Betway CRM team with the goal of helping them grow and retain a valuable customer base. You will apply analytical techniques to help the retention director and various retention heads of department make informed decisions on marketing offers/ communication strategies and customer experience improvements.

Duties Include  But Not Limited To
Working closely with the retention director and heads off retention to define metrics and KPIs to monitor the performance and ROI on macro level retention strategies.
Provide regular reporting and insights on:
Marketing campaign performance and ROI.
Engagement rates from communication campaigns and its success at influencing intended behaviours.
Daily Sports and Casino P&L.
Churn rates and customer value.
New game and vendor launch performance.
Effectiveness of casino game placements on casino lobby.
Performance of marketing segments and targeted behaviour.
Customer engagement of new marketing features e.g. prize wheel/ free bet club and its success at influencing intended behaviours.
Working with the data science and CRM team to suggest new customer segments and improve retention models.
Working with the product analytics and CRM team to measure and assess customer engagement of site banners/new marketing features and other web features related to retention marketing.
Working with regional AI Analysts to help conceptualise  define and deliver new retention reports  as well as improving existing ones for their markets.

About The Role

The Strategic Intelligence team works cross-functionally  focusing on competitive intelligence and performance benchmarking within the competitive landscape. As an Intelligence Data Analyst  you will be responsible for assisting the various teams with business and industry-related questions. Successful candidates will answer these broad  sometimes ambiguous questions by utilizing a variety of data sources available to the team.

Additionally  this role will serve as a data consultant  helping various stakeholders understand what is possible from a data perspective and how to frame questions that can then be answered with existing data resources. You will also be responsible for building and maintaining a variety of regular reporting dashboards and reports. Lastly  you will be asked to assist our data engineers in developing and maintaining data integrations  as well as fixing data issues as they arise.

You should be an ambitious and curious individual who is excited by the challenge of conducting research in a highly technical  yet rapidly developing industry. You will be expected to consume and analyze large amounts of data  including unstructured alternative data sources. You will also need to maintain a high degree of attention to detail with every project  as data integrity is critical for decision-making. Experience with SQL and Python are a must. Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn everything about cryptocurrency are a requirement for this role.

Your mission  should you choose to accept it  will be to bridge the gap between technical data engineers and business leaders  with both written and verbal communication. This is the most challenging  yet rewarding aspect of the role.

This is a fully remote role  we will consider applicants based in North America  South America and Europe.

Qualifications

2+ years of professional work experience in the field of business intelligence  data mining  and/or advanced analytics such as Tableau  SAS Visual Analytics  Alteryx  Power BI  LookML  Birst  Microstrategy and Qliksense
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to disaggregate issues  identify root causes and recommend solutions
Adept in forecasting  regression analysis and segmentation work

Understanding of modeling techniques specifically logistic regression  linear regression  cluster analysis  CHAID  etc.
Good written and verbal communication in English
Industry experience in consumer goods/retail is a plus
What You'll Do

You will develop capabilities in the revenue management area for our global clients.

In this role  you will work with the Insights & Analytics group and consulting teams at McKinsey  helping solve analytically complex client problems in the marketing domain  applying and administrating analytical/modeling tools and techniques and drawing managerial insights through statistical techniques and predictive modeling.

You will service clients with additional responsibilities in knowledge development and capability building. You will perform general statistical analysis and modeling in client engagements for marketing efforts as well as develop statistical models to measure and optimize pricing and promotions.

You will provide expert advice to consulting teams on technique/modeling related issues. You will support the development and maintenance of proprietary McKinsey marketing techniques and other knowledge development projects and deliver high quality end products on time and perform quality checks wherever required. With time you will coach and mentor new colleagues by sharing business  functional and technical expertise.

Examples of similar projects you may work on

Pricing Improving revenue management for a global player in Consumer Packaged Goods (FMCG). We performed a set of analysis to determine the impact of price changes on sales volume change. We used our advanced analytics tools to build a mathematical model that explains how the volume is transferred between products after a price change. We combined results which allowed us to build a simulator in which the client could test how much volume they would lose or gain (including re-capture effect on other products from their portfolio) after they executed price changes.

Promo Building a transparency tool to analyze effectiveness of promo events for a client in Consumer Packaged Goods (FMCG). We consolidated a clients internal and external datasets and built a standardized  dynamic visualization / transparency tool to analyze historical effectiveness of promo events and drivers of performance. The result was new promo guidelines and updated promo calendars for the upcoming year  enabling the client to maximize their ROI and volume uplift. The transparency and planning tool enabled continuous and holistic review of performance as well as tailoring promo plans in order to allocate the promo investment in the most effective way.

Please note that previous knowledge about marketing or sales-related topics is not mandatory. Were recruiting individuals with different level of experience  hence the recommendation about the level of the role will be shared during the recruiting process  based on your experience and skills.

Who You'll Work With

Youll be based in Wroclaw or Lisbon and will be part of Periscope  and our Marketing & Sales practice solutions team. You will primarily support the Insights & Analytics (IA) group of Periscope. You will also be part of our global Client Capabilities Network. Colleagues in this group deliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.

Periscope leverages decades of McKinseys marketing and sales experience helping leading companies improve pricing  promotion  assortments  and performance management. Periscopes combination of software  tailored services  and expertise provides our clients with a granular view of their commercial and financial performance by gathering and integrating their landscape of data and information into a central data warehouse. Clients can use our intuitive interface to make decisions based on advanced analytics and can embed new pricing  commercial  and performance management capabilities throughout their organization.

Marketing & Sales solutions fosters innovation driven by analytics  design thinking  mobile and social by developing new products/services and integrating them into our client work. It is helping to shift our model toward asset-based consulting and is a foundation for and expands our investment in our entrepreneurial culture. Through innovative software as service solutions  strategic acquisitions  and a vibrant ecosystem of alliances  we are redefining what it means to work with McKinsey. To learn more  visit http //www.periscope-solutions.com/

Problem solving - someone that can think outside the box and would consider themselves a logical thinker.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills  with confidence attending and hosting calls.

About the Role
As a Senior Sales Data Analyst  you will play a leading role in making our sales organization more data-driven. You will independently manage & execute analytical projects e.g.  develop & manage dashboards within our BI tool  managing data streams that enable our analyses  doing performance analyses  support with business planning  forecasting  target setting  and building compensation models. This means you will work on a great variety of analytical tasks  and collaborate with a large group of ambitious and like-minded people.

About Otrium
Founded and headquartered in Amsterdam  were a purpose-led business  we believe all clothing should be worn.
Right now  lots of fashion stays unsold. For the resources that went in and for the people who miss out  its such a shame. Were here to fix this. We are an online fashion outlet marketplace and we tech-enable designer brands to find an owner for every item they produce.
We give brands an online outlet channel and digital tools to smartly connect dynamically-priced end-of-season collections with fashion-lovers. Then we give them the data so they can reproduce most-wanted items.
Our app re-imagines outlet shopping helping customers easily find reduced-price gems. We give end-of-season fashion a new start  which is smarter for the wardrobe  smarter for the wallet and smarter for the industry.

We seek someone who will:
Build & manage data flows in our BI tool in collaboration with our Business Intelligence team
Build from scratch & manage performance dash-boarding in our BI tool

Deep-dive in productivity and efficiency of the sales teams and streamline processes (including x-functional ways of working) so they can be even more successful in their day-to-day tasks

What do you need to have?
A relevant Masters degree in a quantitative direction: (e.g.  analytics  data  econometrics  mathematics  physics);
4+ years of experience in a similar role (business or commercial analyst  dash-boarding specialist)
Experience with working extensively (on a daily basis) with a BI tool
Experience with commercial analytics
Proficient user of SQL and other relevant programming skills
Experience with structuring complex analyses  and communicating results in a simplified way
Experience with working in a cross-functional environment  with different stakeholders
Experience with a digital business or at a scale-up organization is a plus

YOU ARE...
A critical  independent  analyst  who can bring data to life by taking end-to-end ownership in making data accessible to others & translating its insights into action
Strong commercial person and like to think creatively about business opportunities
Eager to bring structure in complex situations
Curious and proactive in questioning business decisions
Determined to deliver accurate and flawless results  with an eye for the details
A true team player with strong interpersonal skills: you like to collaborate with a large team and many different stakeholders
Flexible to quickly switch focus to changing priorities on a daily base

What its like to work at Otrium
You will be part of an enthusiastic and highly ambitious team with a growth and entrepreneurial mindset;
The possibility to learn  grow  and contribute to one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe  and soon the US (with your help!);
Freedom and responsibility: we believe in ownership  so we will give you full responsibility to make sure you can get the job done;
Youll be working with very talented colleagues - in a different time zone - that know what they are doing as everyone has experience at other amazing fast-growing companies;
Next to working together  we celebrate our success together. With every target we make and record we break  we celebrate!

What's next?
Excited about what you're reading? Let us know more about who you are and why we should work together! Apply now! We look forward to hearing from you!

As a Data Analyst  you will need analytical and problem solving skills as well as programming experience to be able to analyse large data sets of information with the appropriate tools and techniques.

In this role you will be part of customer's Business Platforms Insights Division  providing information for the process of delivering insight and innovation through data  analytics  engagement and consultancy services to insurers and/or reinsurers  across the full spectrum of insurance  reinsurance  and capital markets.

You will use our customer's suite of analytical tools (Alteryx  Tableau  PowerBI etc.) supported by the actual data warehouse platforms (MS SQL Server  AWS  Redshift etc.).

You Will
Support other analysts through the implementation of best practices of analytics  through knowledge sharing  through mentoring and formal training.
Become an expert in new technologies that are introduced by upskilling through focused training and self-learning.
Participate in and contribute to our Data Analyst Chapter forums and activities.
Design  develop  test  tune  deploy data pipeline solutions and hand off to support teams to operate
Maintain up to date Technical and Operational documentation
Manage task list and communicate updates to stakeholders and team members following an Agile Scrum methodology
Work as key member of the core team to support the timely and efficient delivery of critical data integration deliverables
Requirements
Minimum of 3 years experience working a high performing team with a focus on service delivery to a broad range of global  diverse customers across different levels and time / geographic regions.
Demonstrate expertise in analytics and data insights using tools such as Alteryx  Tableau  PowerBI  Trifacta  Talend  etc.
Experience in databases such as AWS  SQL Server  Redshift etc.
Fluent in English
Must be a portuguese citizen or have a work permit for Portugal OR
Must be a spanish citizen or have a work permit for Spain
Experience In Following Is a Plus
Financial or professional services industry experience (insurance  wholesale banking  retail banking  consultancy)
Degree in IT or Data Science qualification with high analytical content (such as data analytics / statistics / computer science) would be desirable
Post-graduate qualifications (in related disciplines) would be advantageous
Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM
Fluency in Portuguese  Spanish or French is a plus
Soft Skills
Commitment: You should be committed to the project  vision  team and the business.
The Power of No: Many times  you will have to say no to the business and not develop every single idea that the business can think of.
Vision: Clearly communicate the vision between the small backlog items and the larger business goal. Ability to understand the bigger picture and go deep in functional/technical details
Curiosity: You should always be curious to ask the Why questions from the business and how from the development team
What We Offer

We offer a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data  Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects  you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path.

Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data  digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better  making data matter.

About The Team

Since 2015  Revolut has introduced over 14.5 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls  to global currency exchange and stock trading  customers simply get more with Revolut.

We approach marketing at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues  and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to new feature presentations  our goal is to both inform and delight. Put simply  we build things we want to use ourselves  that were proud to show to our friends and families.

The Growth team is the engine that drives Revoluts growth across the globe. We focus on community-driven and marketing-driven approaches to ensure our product is the preferred choice for the majority of people living in a target country or region.

The Growth department is constantly innovating and trying new ways to grow Revolut faster and more effectively. We work like special forces: from acquisition to engagement  we own our markets  are passionate about Revolut  and use our know-how to grow the brand and our user base at breakneck speed.

About The Role

Were looking for talented Data Analysts to join the business and start producing insights and analytics from day one.

The right candidate will focus on reporting how Revolut achieves its growth targets and will deliver actionable marketing and product insights leading to a continuous improvement of our marketing impact.

You will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve strategic and operational KPIs  and developing appropriate dashboards to maximise the understanding of the whole business about performance understanding.

You will work closely with business stakeholders  Data Engineering and Product Owners to help the business improve its decision making capabilities.

We are looking for someone with a strong quantitative background  excellent technical skills  and sound business acumen.

What You'll Be Doing

Understand our business and its processes through our data
Produce analysis and insights to help the business make key decisions which will boost Growth
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base and maximise profitability
Design key metrics to quantify the impact of our marketing activities
Maintain and create new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Conducting deep-dive analysis to really understand complex problems

What You'll Need

Previous experience in a data or analytical role
Proficient in SQL
Data-driven storytelling and visualisation skills
Attention to detail
Experience coding in Python
Experience creating dashboards (with tools like Tableau/PowerBI/Metabase  etc.)

NICE TO HAVE

Previous experience in Marketing or Growth Analytics
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Masters)
Strong stats and hands-on experience (statsmodels  Bayesian Analytics  etc)

Please note  this role can be based in: UK  Germany  Portugal  Spain  France  Poland  Lithuania  Romania  Ireland.

A little about usWhen Revolut was founded in 2015  we had a vision to build a sustainable  digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health  empower them to have more control  and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2021 with 15 million Personal customers and over half a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services.

What were looking forRevolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. Were looking for people who align with our five core values: we believe that we Get it Done because we Think Deeper and are strongly rooted in the Dream Team. We Never Settle hence why we always Deliver Wow. You want to join a community forward thinking people - we are here for you. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work  giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means youre not just another cog in the machine.

The Benefits

Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations  flights  and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings  our 4 000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity  creativity  and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership ?enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Overview:

We are looking for analysts to join the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia based in Bangkok  Thailand. Agoda is a strongly data driven organization: as a Data Analyst  your insights will impact strategic and tactical decisions driving business growth.

Responsibilities:

You will work in the Data Analytics team to deliver significant and action-oriented analyses and recommendations to your stakeholders  to help drive decision-making with insights from customer data analysis.

Your work will be project-oriented  since you will get the opportunity to own analytical projects  starting from understanding stakeholder needs and problem definition  to the analysis and interpretation of results as well as communicating the findings to the Operational teams or other groups in Agoda (Marketing  Product  Partners Services). Typical analysis projects can be:
Predictive modeling  e. g. of customer wait times or future call demand
Segmentation of customers based on differing usage patterns of our customer service
Design and implementation of new dashboards for business users
Responsibilities are:
Work with stakeholders to understand their business needs and identify opportunities for analysis insight to inform their decision-making
Understand and report to your team and senior management on business performance
Ensure delivery of regular reports on time and without error
Self-manage delivery of analytical projects
Defining the business problem
Determining the analytical approach
Efficiently extract relevant data
Appropriately use statistical and data analysis techniques
Sharing your findings using impactful data visualizations and efficient communication
Balance multiple priorities  updating stakeholders on progress and expected delivery
(Encourage and train department members in best practice use of Agoda data  analysis techniques and interpretation)
Qualifications And Experience
Bachelors degree in computer sciences  engineering  mathematics  statistics  data science or a related degree program with outstanding academic results
0-3 years work experience (Senior: 4+ years of relevant experience  preferably working with large datasets and experimentation)
SQL proficiency required: can extract data from large databases using SQL to develop data queries
Excellent problem solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems
Expert Excel user: able to understand and build complex spreadsheets
Strong business sense
Excellent communication and comprehension skills: confident communicating with people of differing levels of seniority  analytical understanding and from a wide variety of backgrounds
Organized and structured: can manage multiple  competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines and pressure
Fluent in English both spoken and written  additional languages are a plus
Attitude
Must be curious  proactive  practical and solution-oriented with Get it done! attitude
Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers: love the idea of working in an international and multicultural company  analyzing billions of actions from millions of travelers choosing from thousands of hotels
Must want to tell an impactful story with analysis and smart data visualization  not just number crunch
Able and willing to share your opinion and propose ideas to improve operations based on data and have an impact on the customer experience
Able to work in a highly multi-cultural team
Attentive to detail and committed to data integrity
Aware of the importance of discretion  confidentiality  and ethics
Good To Have (but Not Required)
Experience in management consulting
Expert in one data analysis package  such as R  Python or VBA
Experience with dashboarding / visualization software like Tableau
What We Offer
Be part of a dynamic and exciting data-driven multinational team in a successful and fast growing tech company
A clearly defined career path will help you to continuously develop your skills
The chance to propose ideas to improve operations based on data and have an impact on the customer experience
Benefit :
Relocation package for employees joining from abroad
International health insurance
Annual performance bonus
Parking fees reimburse
Discount for Agoda employee booking on Agoda.com

About Ferring:By building strong relationships within the scientific community  our medical affairs team has become a trusted partner among patient groups  clinicians and health policy decision makers. We pride ourselves on developing and disseminating information to our key stakeholders so that they can provide the best care for our patients. Because we oversee the entire lifecycle for many of our products  were on the forefront of developing valuable and scientifically grounded information that will chart exciting paths forward for many of our innovative brands. Join our expert team and drive innovation.
Job Description:
Ferring Pharmaceuticals  a specialty biopharmaceutical company with operations worldwide  is looking for an Internship global data Analyst.



Your new company

Ferring Pharmaceuticals is a research-driven  specialty biopharmaceutical group committed to helping people around the world build families and live better lives. Headquartered in Saint-Prex  Switzerland  Ferring is a leader in reproductive medicine and womens health  and in specialty areas within gastroenterology and urology. Ferring has been developing treatments for mothers and babies for over 50 years and has a portfolio covering treatments from conception to birth. Founded in 1950  privately-owned Ferring now employs over 6 000 people worldwide  has its own operating subsidiaries in nearly 60 countries and markets its products in 110 countries. To learn more about Ferring or its products please visit www.ferring.com.



Your new role

Are you ready to gain real work experience with a global data & analytics team ? By joining us you will learn and be at the center of our data and integration activities. As part of our growing Lisbon center of excellence  you will be coached by IT architects based in Lisbon and Switzerland. You will be part of a multi-cultural team serving our customers and patients around the globe. Its a great opportunity to put your career on the right track  the track of data! You will learn about Integration & modern data technologies like Informatica  SAP CPI  Biztalk  Azure Data services and PowerBI but as well agile methodology based on SAFE.



We can offer flexible working hours and part time works to ensure you can continue to your education and have time required during your exams.



Key Responsibilities:
Monitoring and Operating our existing Interface / Integration.
Will gradually be involved in delivering improvement on existing solution.
Will write Technical documentation and knowledge article on our existing interface.
Developing reports to measure our service levels.



Required Education/Qualifications/Skills:
Computer science students Bachelor or Master degree who want to get experience in Data & Integration works
Programming knowledge (ideally Java or .Net development) is a plus
Knowledge of network and integration (Rest API  Webservice) is a plus
Knowledge of database and SQL is a plus
Building PowerBI report experience is a plus
Passionate about learning technology and data
Excellent communication skills and very capable of building & keeping good working relation with end users
The position requires an open minded  highly analytical  independent and well-structured person
Good interpersonal skills and be able to get along with co-workers
Accept flexible working hours
Good communication skills (written and spoken) in English



What you'll get in return
Inspiration from our commitment to advocate for everyones right to build a family  no matter who you are  where you live or who you love. Motivation from innovation in our chosen therapy areas and ongoing development of our organization.

What you need to do
If you're interested in this role  please apply now.

These are our mindsets and what you can expect from us:

Fair & Courageous
We promote Ask Me Anything sessions  a moment where any employee can question  suggest or share any topic live with the CEO.

Ambition & Results
We believe in supporting the personal and professional growth of our employees. Thats why we have a differentiated career path management supported by a transparent model  capable of identifying  developing and adding value to your skills.

Learning & Innovating

Caring & Sharing

ABOUT BOLD
We are focused on developing and delivering innovative technological solutions through a unique combination of technology expertise and agility  maximizing business value for our clients.
Our focus when it comes to supporting our clients digital journey is about clear choices that build & develop skills in a very targeted way.
Since 2018  BOLD by Devoteam has been part of the Devoteam Group  a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA  with a revenue of 761M. Together  we share a common vision of transforming technology to create value for our clients  partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people.

WANT TO APPLY?
Send me your cv to ritamiguel@boldint.com

Why join us?
We are helping medical doctors on their day-to-day  by creating a new digital ecosystem where they can easily access the most useful professional resources. By wasting less time searching for the content & tools they need  they have more time for what really matters: their patients.

Tonic App is speeding up! We are conquering new markets  building even more amazing tools and our team is getting bigger!

We are looking for a Data Analyst for our Growth Team and this is a great opportunity for you if you are looking for an exciting career change in a fast-growing start-up and you want to be part of a company that is shaping the future of digital health.

Be part of a talented  smart and easy-going team that is our best asset and great to work with!

What do we expect?
You excel at leveraging data analysis & quantitative methods to solve user problems and drive business growth.
You know how to synthesize the information instead of summarizing it. You separate the signal from the noise and understand that the value comes from a few key insights and not from tons of data or pages of information.
You understand business questions and ideas and transform them effectively into analytical questions and requirements. You can communicate your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You are obsessed with organization and have top-notch organizational  time  and task management skills.
You are methodological and you approach any problem by first understanding its nature and designing an adequate problem solving methodology.
You are executionally rigorous but methodologically flexible. You always double check the data you present and the team can rely on the quality and validity of your insights. You are strict when the approach requires it but flexible in selecting the right approach.
You enjoy putting your hands on multiple areas of the company from user acquisition and lifecycle marketing to activation  referral  retention  and monetisation.
You like to work in a multi-disciplinary team including marketers  engineers  and data scientists.

Responsibilities
Build quantitative models & simulations for the growth problems at hand by leveraging financial modelling and econometrics.
Help design growth experiments by defining hypotheses and measurement approaches. Create experiment control dashboards  monitor the experiment performance  and draw experiment conclusions.
Set-up  define  and maintain clear and consistent definitions for all data products under your scope: metrics  dashboards  reports  deep dives  data schemas  etc.
Execute statistical analysis by applying ANOVA  regression  factor analysis  PCA  clustering  etc. to discover relationships between variables and causality of changes in the data patterns.
Prepare deep dives and reports. Engineer dashboards tracking business performance. Produce relevant  clear  and actionable insights from data for the problems at hand.
Run behavioral and predictive cohort analysis to identify customer behaviors that we need to influence across the entire customer lifecycle.
Monitor and analyze acquisition and lifecycle campaigns to improve their efficiency.
Analyze data on consumer behavior  market size and trends to uncover actionable insights and assess the attractiveness of new markets  product use cases  target audiences  and marketing strategies.

Who you are
A degree in Mathematics  Statistics  Economics  or other quantitative discipline.
A deep understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design
Experience with Product Analytics tools (Mixpanel  Amplitude)  BI platforms (Looker  Tableau  Periscope)  Google Analytics and Google Data Studio.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying the data.
Knowledge of Python/R for deep dives is a plus as analyses sometimes require data wrangling that goes beyond SQL.
Domain experience in growth models  attribution models  LTV models  monetisation models  CRM analytics  and Marketing Analytics.

Join us in helping doctors save lives!

Kantars Worldpanel division is searching for a Data Analyst to join our Analytical Solutions Team. Based in Lisbon  Portugal  this is an opportunity to be part of the companys exciting vision for the future!

Kantar is the worlds leading data  insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think  feel  shop  share  vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies  Kantars 30 000 people help the worlds leading organisations succeed and grow.

Kantars Worldpanel division is the global expert in consumer behaviour. Through continuous monitoring  advanced analytics and tailored solutions  Kantar Worldpanel inspires successful decisions by brand owners  retailers  market analysts and government organisations globally. With over 60 years experience  a team of 3 500  and services covering 60 countries directly or through partners  Kantar Worldpanel turns purchase behaviour into competitive advantage in markets as diverse as FMCG  textile  baby products  telecommunications and entertainment  as well as many others.

Worldpanel has been designated as a growth platform for Kantar  with significant investments being made into our products and technology to significantly enhance the delivery of insights to our clients. Equally  its introduction is a huge enabler to bring global consistency  efficiency and automation to many of the operational processes we have in our business.

ROLE'S MISSION

We are embarking on a new exciting challenge to significantly improve our analytical capability and this position will play a pivotal role in making this happen.

Our Analytical Solutions Team provides the opportunity to quickly grow your expertise in the field of Data Science by working and learning with a group of analysts and with some of the most powerful analysis tools and techniques available to understand the real-life consumer behaviour.

At Kantar Worldpanel  we are looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for advanced analytics solutions who will make a significant impact on blue-chip companies  embarking on an exciting challenge to significantly improve our global analytical capability.

In this role  you'll act as a Global Advanced Anlytics Analyst  where you will play a pivotal role in developing a new suite of software solutions that require advanced analytical procedures embedded within them to meet the increasingly complex needs of our clients. To do so  you will work with an international community of experts to embed best-in-class data collection and preparation through top-end  efficient coding ending with dynamic final client deliverables.

Utilizing industry-leading consumer information and advanced analytical techniques  you will help our customers address their toughest marketing-related issues and identify opportunities to grow.

A challenging position within a fast-growing  dynamic  and innovative company working in an international role. The opportunity allows for growth and choice in a new and exciting career path.

Advanced Analytics is the driving engine of global growth within KWP providing huge scope of personal development.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with Kantar Worldpanel local and global advanced analytics team as well as key clients to create best in class outputs to deliver to our suite of clients
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data to help build solutions to answer our clients business questions.
Work on the development of new skills  new analytical approaches and new ways of representing insight.
Acting as an analytical expert on key global projects  providing advice internally to ensure that our approaches and outputs remain best-in-class.
Support the development of junior members of the team  building the analytical and technical skills and offering problem-solving advice on specific projects.

REQUIREMENTS

University degree in a mathematical/scientific discipline  preferably with a statistics element.
Ability to code in R essential. Knowledge of Shiny R  SAS  Python etc advantageous.
Knowledge of relevant modelling techniques  clustering techniques  regression  probability modelling etc.
Great organisational skills with the right level of creativity.
Critical thinking and collaborative leadership.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Fluent in English (other languages are advantageous).

JOIN US

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple  clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture  where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We also make sure we create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included  accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well-being is taken into consideration.

Kantar's values include recognised expertise  being one step ahead  working together  going the extra mile and putting ourselves in our clients' shoes! We go beyond the obvious  using intelligence  passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. If you share these values  apply for a career thats out of the ordinary and join us!

WHO WE ARE

At BladeInsight  our mission is to empower decision-makers in the renewable energy sector with cost-effective and reliable solutions for the collection and analysis of high-quality data through advanced robotics and AI-powered analytics  moving beyond inspections to continuous and comprehensive asset management.
We have developed a solution for the inspection of wind turbine blades using autonomous drones and state-of-the-art sensors. Thanks to this solution  we have collected over 55 TB of data from over 20 000 blades in 17 countries. This data is processed on our cloud platform BladeInsight  where we use Image Processing and Machine Learning to help our clients know the status of their wind blades and how to best manage them.
Our team is our core asset. We believe in betting on its members  enabling them to grow in proportion to skills and not seniority. Therefore  we are looking for people who are solution-oriented  curious and willing to learn  and who enjoy taking initiative and working in a multicultural environment.

WHAT YOULL BE DOING

Designing state of the art algorithms to detect and categorise features found on wind turbine blades
Implementing and maintaining production level data science code base and infrastructure
Working within the Data Science team and extracting insights from our large database to help clients optimise their wind farm operations
Working together with the Web Development team to see your work integrated on our platform
Assisting in Product Management with road-mapping and feature delivery
Keep learning: learn new technologies and dont be afraid of trying something new

WHICH SKILLS YOULL BRING

Python  at least 1 year experience
OpenCV (or similar)  would be a plus
TensorFlow 2.x would be a plus
Image D-CNN experience would be a plus
Data analytics would be a plus
Passionate about writing well-structured  efficient and maintainable code  actively keeping the quality of the code base in check
Comfortable working in an English-speaking & fast-paced environment
Continuous use of development best practices and version control systems

WHAT WE OFFER

Full workstation with all the tech you need
Flexible working hours and freedom to work from home
Competitive salary + Health insurance + Coverflex benefits card

Superpedestrian is engineering the future of micromobility. The Superpedestrian team is composed of some of the most talented operations specialists  policy managers  designers and engineers  all focused on transforming the future urban mobility. Our scooters  called LINK  were designed to prioritize safety from the inside out  and our Superpedestrian team is dedicated to building meaningful local and city partnerships across the world. Join us!

Superpedestrian is seeking a Data Analyst to join our operations team. This data-driven role requires a combination of analytical thinking  operational expertise  and solid stakeholder management. The Data Analyst will work cross-functionally and will directly influence decision making and strategy implementation at a global scale.This is an exciting opportunity to be directly involved in transforming sustainable urban mobility in a rapidly growing organization.

What Youll Do
Strategy: What are the main operational KPIs that we should focus on to scale the business? You will play a key role in informing the business strategy for 2022
Analytics: Utilize data to understand marketplace dynamics and make recommendations on how to adjust pricing  operational zones and product configurations that improve user experience and operational efficiency.
Prepare data from different sources for analysis and make recommendations based upon those findings.
Write SQL queries and python scripts to answer business questions and automate business critical processes
Analyze demand and utilization to extract actionable insights

Technical proficiency in SQL - experience writing  validating and QAing complex SQL queries

Motivated to work towards a greener future for inner-city mobility

Why Youd Want To Join Us
Were different.
We are born of engineers  not venture capitalists. Our control centre and test labs are located in Cambridge  Massachusetts  alongside MIT and Harvard University. We have some of the sharpest minds in the industry  and we hold more than 30 patents for our amazing technologies. None of our competitors come close.
LINK is the result of eight years developing our artificial intelligence-driven safety platform  and two years designing a robust chassis and efficient powertrain to match. We take our time to get our technology  our operations and our recruitment just right  because we think long-term.
And were growing fast. Youll have the opportunity to shape our company and the way we work  and make a real difference to communities through our services.
Superpedestrian actively encourages applications from people of all backgrounds. If you think you meet most of the requirements  but not every single point on the job description  please still apply! Wed love to have a chat and see if you'd be a great addition to our team.

About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade  Kraken has risen to become one of the largest  most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank  providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter.

Our diverse group of 2 400+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture  united by a shared passion for delighting customers  upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve  are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential.

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and were just getting started. Were growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

This is a fully remote role  we will consider applicants based in North America  South America and Europe.

We are looking for Data Analysts who will play a key role in driving decision making in building cutting-edge products at Kraken. You will transform large datasets from complex systems  generate actionable insights and share the results with stakeholders at all levels of the company. Great benefits  amazing perks  remote work  stock incentives  and a flexible PTO policy make Kraken a great place to work.

Partner with product managers to design experiments to test hypothesis and help with idea generation and refinement
Collaborate with engineering teams and stakeholders to build key datasets and data pipelines using Python/ETL frameworks.
Be a data evangelist and help Kraken improve its products and services.

Qualifications
