4+ years of professional work experience in the field of business intelligence and/or advanced analytics
Previous experience in projects or complex tasks/initiatives coordination

Industry experience in consumer goods/retail is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to disaggregate issues  identify root causes and recommend solutions
Adept in forecasting  regression analysis and segmentation work
Statistical programming software experience in R or Python. Willingness to learn the other one
Comfortable working with large data sets; Python  SAS & SQL experience preferred

What You'll Do

You will work with the Insights & Analytics group and consulting teams at McKinsey  helping solve analytically complex client problems in the marketing domain  applying and administrating analytical/modeling tools and techniques and drawing managerial insights through statistical techniques and predictive modeling.

In this role you will service clients with additional responsibilities in knowledge development and capability building. You will perform general statistical analysis and modeling in client engagements for marketing efforts as well as develop statistical models to measure and optimize pricing and promotions. You will provide expert advice to consulting teams on technique/modeling related issues. You will support the development and maintenance of proprietary McKinsey marketing techniques and other knowledge development projects and deliver high quality end products on time and perform quality checks wherever required.

As a senior team member  you will be responsible for the success of your own projects but you will also ensure that the team progress well with work. We will count on you to find solutions for potential challenges that you or other team members may face. You will work with clients at operational level and conduct client presentations. You will coach more junior colleagues  supervise their work and support them with your experience when needed.

Examples of similar projects you may work on

Pricing Improving revenue management for a global player in Consumer Packaged Goods (FMCG). We performed a set of analysis to determine the impact of price changes on sales volume change. We used our advanced analytics tools to build a mathematical model that explains how the volume is transferred between products after a price change. Combined results from these two analysis allowed us to build a simulator in which the client could test how much volume will they lose or gain (including re-capture effect on other products from their portfolio) after they execute price change.

Promo Building a transparency tool to analyze effectiveness of promo events for a client in Consumer Packaged Goods (FMCG).We have consolidated clients internal and external datasets and built a standardized  dynamic visualization / transparency tool to analyze historical effectiveness of promo events and drivers of performance  across all their business units. The result were new promo guidelines and updated promo calendars for the upcoming year  enabling the client to maximize their ROI and volume uplift. The transparency and planning tool enabled continuous and holistic review of performance as well as tailoring promo plans in order to allocate the promo investment in the most effective way. Please note that previous knowledge about marketing or sales-related topics is not mandatory. Were recruiting individuals with different level of experience  hence the recommendation about the level of the role will be shared during the recruiting process  based on your experience and skills.

Who You'll Work With

Youll be based in Wroclaw or Lisbon and will be part of Periscope  and our Marketing & Sales practice solutions team. You will primarily support the Insights & Analytics (IA) group of Periscope. You will also be part of our global Client Capabilities Network. Colleagues in this group deliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.

Periscope leverages decades of McKinseys marketing and sales experience helping leading companies improve pricing  promotion  assortments  and performance management. Periscopes combination of software  tailored services  and expertise provides our clients with a granular view of their commercial and financial performance by gathering and integrating their landscape of data and information into a central data warehouse. Clients can use our intuitive interface to make decisions based on advanced analytics and can embed new pricing  commercial  and performance management capabilities throughout their organization.

Marketing & Sales solutions fosters innovation driven by analytics  design thinking  mobile and social by developing new products/services and integrating them into our client work. It is helping to shift our model toward asset-based consulting and is a foundation for -and expands our investment in -our entrepreneurial culture. Through innovative software as service solutions  strategic acquisitions  and a vibrant ecosystem of alliances  we are redefining what it means to work with McKinsey. To learn more  visit http //www.periscope-solutions.com/

Job Description

Do you want to be part of this exciting opportunity to join a dedicated team of experts in GKN Automotive's new Business Services (GBS) situated in Porto?

Working out of recently refurbished  state of the art offices we provide multifunctional support to GKN Automotive's global delivery activities across Finance  Procurement  Masterdata Management  HR & Sales Order Management.

Our vision is to deliver sustainable value with standard  consistent  digitally enhanced processes and to achieve this we are seeking to attract highly motivated and skilled professionals. In return we offer a corporate culture which champions professional development  embraces and leads change  creates ingenious solutions for our customers and encourages collaboration.

The Master Data Analyst will ensure the highest degree of data quality and oversee elements of the self-service portals.

This role will be responsible for the setup  administration and maintenance of master records utilized across the business processes .

The Key Responsibilities Include
Handle the supplier  customer and finance master data and transactional data content  ensuring accuracy to enable business process consistency and maintain the highest degree of data quality
Facilitate the supplier certification process through capturing the outputs in the relevant databases and proactively monitor to track continued adherence  following the established RFI form and Due Diligence Procedure
Support the review of quality documentation from suppliers to confirm adherence to specification and capture outputs in relevant databases
Act as the main point of contact for the process scope  in the sites the MDM Analyst is assigned to
Apart from the process scope  there are other responsibilities related to data quality  such as analyzing the Master Data of these workstreams to eliminate duplicate and defective records &ndash- this is one of the missions for this role &ndash- to not only ensure the accomplishment of the in-scope services  but actually  improve the overall quality of data in the sites for which the MDM Analyst is responsible
Follow processes and procedures to ensure data quality  and work cross-functionally to resolve data issues to ensure all business processes run as planned
Interact with Business Partners and GKN employees when master changes or verifications are needed (supporting Supplier Communications if needed)
Implement the master data management programme and set of processes for all business data required to efficiently execute worldwide business transactions.
The Skills And Capabilities We Are Looking For
Bachelor's degree in Accounting  Management or related curriculum
Operated in complex environment with the same size and scale
Knowledge of ERP systems  processes and workflow technology
Highly motivated and able to think clearly under pressure
Have good communication skills  with a very good command in English (other foreign language is a plus)
Be trustworthy and self-motivated and with excellent organizing abilities- Availability to travel if required.
About Us

GKN Automotive is the market leader in conventional  all-wheel and electrified drive systems and solutions. With a comprehensive global footprint  we design  develop  manufacture and integrate an extensive range of driveline technologies for over 90% of the worlds car manufacturers. Diversity and Inclusion As a global engineering company  innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success. A balance of cultures  ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN Automotive. We need people of different backgrounds  with different skills and perspectives to spark originality  imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world. GKN Automotive is an equal opportunity employer. We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age  race  creed  colour  national origin  ancestry  marital status  affectional or sexual orientation  gender identity or expression  disability  nationality  sex  or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please contact us to request any such accommodation.

At Talkdesk  we are courageous innovators focused on redefining customer experience  making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And  we give back to our community by volunteering our time  supporting non-profits and minimizing our global footprint. Each day  thousands of employees  customers and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.

We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations  including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding  a valuation of more than $10 Billion  and a ranking of #17 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list  now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.

If you have a good grasp of information technology and enjoy interpreting and analysing data  turning it into information that can offer ways to improve a business  thus affecting business decisions  while also working with a variety of people along the way then a career as a business data analyst could be for you.

Business data analysts look at how the business operates  conducting research and analysing data to develop their knowledge  and suggest methods for the company to improve their practices and processes.

You Will
Analyze data and turn it into information that can help improve Talkdesks support organization and influence decisions within the team.
Gather information from various sources and assess patterns and trends in data sets  reporting back the findings in a comprehensive study to the wider business/management team.
Design potential solutions to any problems identified during the research phase  while simultaneously working alongside teams within the business or the management team to address business needs
Define new data collection and analysis processes - use data modelling practices to analyse findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes
We Are Looking For
English proficiency (C1/C2) is mandatory. Additional languages are a plus.
A minimum of three years of experience as a business data analyst or a relevant role.
Leadership skills to lead and manage a project plan internally or cross-functionally with internal / external stakeholders.
Organizational skills (attention to detail; ability to write comprehensive reports  etc).
Team player to work with the larger team(s) in improving what needs to be improved.
Analytical thinking (experience in data models and reporting packages  ability to analyse large datasets and draw conclusions  etc).
Strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Lean  Six Sigma Certification; Project Management (PMP) Certification; Agile Certification
A degree in the following subjects is beneficial in developing a career in data analysis:
Mathematics
Computer Science
Statistics
Economics

About The Role

Data sits at the heart of Revolut and plays a uniquely crucial role in what we do. With data we build intelligent real-time systems to personalise our product  tackle financial crime  automate reporting  track team performances and enhance customer experiences. Fundamentally  data underpins all operations at Revolut and being part of the team gives you the chance to have a major impact across the company  apply today to join our world class data function.

What We Need

We are looking for smart and ambitious people who would help us understand our data better and manage a team of data analysts. This is a unique opportunity to learn about many aspects of our business and be involved in the early stages of an innovative new product. Your main weapons will be your team  SQL  dashboards in Looker  and a thorough understanding of our business. You will also be acting as a bridge between product owners and data employees.

What You Will Be Doing

Lead a team of data analysts
Plan the teams roadmap and ensure successful execution of projects
Enforce best practices and high quality output within the team
Create and maintain data models and dashboards in Looker
Create and maintain new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Work together with product teams to understand their objectives to then determine the right metrics and find data-driven insights for them

What You'll Need

Required:

Experience in managing a team and their projects
Experience in creating dashboards and/or reports using SQL
Data-driven storytelling and visualisation skills with BI tools (e.g. Looker  Tableau  PowerBI  Metabase  etc)
Experience in Python to the extent of delivering the same analysis you could do in SQL and a BI tool

Preferred:

Empathy and excellent communication skills
Understanding of best practices in data modelling
Very strong SQL optimisation and profiling skills
Deep understanding of how analytical databases work
Solid experience in software engineering  particularly using Python
Experience with Exasol or a similar MPP system is a huge plus

A little about usWhen Revolut was founded in 2015  we had a vision to build a sustainable  digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health  empower them to have more control  and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2021 with 15 million Personal customers and over half a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services.

What were looking forRevolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. Were looking for people who align with our five core values: we believe that we Get it Done because we Think Deeper and are strongly rooted in the Dream Team. We Never Settle hence why we always Deliver Wow. You want to join a community of forward-thinking people - we are here for you. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work  giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means youre not just another cog in the machine.

The Benefits

Competitive salary
Excellent training and guidance from our team
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Private medical care
Daily meal allowance

Description

Lets talk about Loggi? ??

Through technology (mobile  AI  automation  IOT)  we have created a next-generation logistics network and we are  in an unprecedented way  positioning ourselves to unleash the growth of a new trade in Brazil with a fast  cost-effective and reliable logistics solution.

By the end of 2021  we want to be present in all Brazilian cities and reach the milestone of 5 million deliveries per day by 2025.

With SoftBank  Microsoft  GGV Capital and others  the new investment round has brought Loggis valuation up to US$1 billion hitting the unicorn mark!

Our culture

Inclusive  determined and visionary: that's who we are and how we work here.

We are already more than 1000 Loggers. We are hi-tech  little conservative and we are always up to date! Above all  we hope that everyone is eager to learn and acquire new knowledge quickly.

We look for an increasingly inspiring and welcoming work environment  and we very much hope that you will help us to maintain our culture even at an accelerated pace of growth.

We are very happy to be recognized among the best startups to work according to LinkedIn and Glassdoor  among the 10 most innovative startups by Forbes Brasil and also to be certified by Great Place to Work.

Being part of Loggi must mean that you can be who you are - or want to be. We look for a more accessible country. Thus  we can say that respecting the needs of different people is our reason for existing. This is history  it is culture  it is respect.

Important: All Loggi jobs are also open to people with disabilities (PwD).

Our Engineering team

Loggis engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems  mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees  in a fortified environment by learning  sharing of experiences and respect. Together  we will build the logistics network of the country  developing unique algorithms  systems and processes.

Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario  working in companies like Google and UOL. They are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.

We Believe And Invest In Everyone's Potential

"Over the next 5 years we want to train Brazils future CTOs! Here  we have a structured development program." (Davi Reis  CTO - Chief Technology Officer).

Responsibilities

You will architect and develop scalable solutions through data  being part of multidisciplinare squads seeking an amazing and efficient experience for the users! We will count on you to structure relevant data pipelines that support decision making and to make sure that the teams have access to high quality data information.

Loggis data team works with a wide variety of technologies and techniques to solve our challenges. We try to see beyond the buzzwords to develop solutions in a pragmatic and efficient way.

To spark your curiosity  we work with predictive models trained with sklearn and keras/tensorflow; algorithms of optimization based on or-tools  Systems in Azure and AWS  with and without kubernetes. In addition we also use Looker and ELK for dashboards and analysis.

Above everything  we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.

Requirements

3+ years of relevant work experience in Data Analytics;

Experience with Machine Learning techniques  Data Mining  and Statistical Data Analysis;

Experience with descriptive  predictive and prescriptive analytics

Knowledge of design and analysis of experiments;

Strong analytical and storytelling skills;

Collaborative profile  to work with other data analysts  engineers  product managers  and designers;

Familiarity with agile trends;

Experience with cloud services  (e.g. AWS  GCP)  is a nice to have.

Experience in the academic field is a plus;

Interest in learning more about logistics.

Benefits

Health plan with national coverage (without discounts!)

Flexible hours with the possibility of working at home according to function and demand

Fresh fruit every day at the office

Above average remuneration of the best technology companies in Brazil  with annual reviews

Eligibility for Stock Options

Meal voucher and transportation voucher with symbolic discount of R$ 1

US$ 3 300 for technical development per year

Frequent knowledge exchanges with internal and external professionals

Individual development plan updated every six months

Feedback culture and opportunity to work according to the squad concept

Working with big names in the history of technology in Brazil

Possibility to develop new algorithms with the challenge of creating the new generation of logistics

Health plan for children at no extra cost

6-month maternity leave and 20-day paternity leave

Daycare allowance of  100 per child up to 7 years of age

As a member of the Business Operations team  you will help drive financial and operational efficiency across the entire Synopsys Solutions Group Business Unit.

Through the development of processes and tools  we help senior management and executive teams gather and analyze data  guiding complex decision-making in critical business areas such as project selection  product pricing and resource allocations. This includes capabilities related to project cost analysis  project portfolio planning and related financial modelling.

As a Business Operations Data Analyst  you will work in a wide variety of roles to support management and maintenance and roll-out of these processes  including hands-on deployment of IT infrastructure.

Specific Duties
Install  develop  update  and maintain new system tools related to data gathering and analysis. In addition to setup and configuration of commercial solutions  supporting coding/scripts may be needed to automate data flows.
Work closely with end users across many functional groups (Engineering  Marketing  Finance  etc.) to interpret business needs and translate these into process and/or IT system requirements
Assist with overall solution deployments through internal system verification; co-ordination of user acceptance testing  updating process definitions  training delivery  data entry  and documentation
Provide end-user administrative and technical support for issues related to database planning and reporting tools
Review system usage/performance reports  and take appropriate corrective actions -- ensuring data is entered correctly  completely  consistently and on-time to support financial reporting requirements
Create project and operational metrics/KPIs using spreadsheets  databases  and related scripting tools
Build productive internal/external working relationships with IT teams and solution vendors to advance or maintain our data systems
Required Qualifications
Background in Engineering  Computer Science or Business with a strong IT focus
Bachelors Degree plus 5+ years of related experience in system and data management
Practical experience with technical and administrative aspects of deploying IT solutions
Strong Project Management and task prioritization/co-ordination skills  with experience managing multi-disciplinary development projects and operational support groups
Ability to perform in-depth data analysis using specialized tools and techniques (e.g. PowerPivot  Power BI  DAX  SQL  VBA  C#  Python  etc.)
General ability to use enterprise planning and reporting tools (e.g. SAP  Salesforce  etc.)  spreadsheets  databases  and related technologies
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills. Willingness to work with many remote users and stakeholders across a global organization
Preferred Skills and Experience
Knowledge of Microsoft Project Server or Project Online for project planning/reporting
Specific experience in financial modeling  project/portfolio planning and project cost reporting for R&D technology environments
Business Area Description

Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoCfaster. We offer the worlds broadest portfolio of silicon IPpredesigned blocks of logic  memory  interfaces  analog  security  and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance  power  and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk.

About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade  Kraken has risen to become one of the largest  most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank  providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter.

Our diverse group of 2 400+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture  united by a shared passion for delighting customers  upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve  are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential.

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and were just getting started. Were growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About The Role

This is a fully remote role  we will consider applicants based in North America  South America and Europe.

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is innovative  highly-motivated  and proactive.

For this role  you will be part of a team that builds cutting-edge trading products in the cryptocurrency industry. You will be responsible for transforming data and generating actionable insights into our customer behavior and measuring the performance of Krakens products. You will collaborate and lead projects with product management  engineering  marketing  and growth teams. You will transform data from complex systems  generate performance metrics  and share the results with stakeholders at all levels of the company.

Great benefits  amazing perks  remote work  stock incentives  and a flexible PTO policy make Kraken a great place to work. If you value having a seat at the table and want to make a big impact on guiding the direction of marketing and growth at one of the top crypto exchanges in the world  this role is for you.

Responsibilities

Partner with product  engineering  marketing  finance and other relevant stakeholders to identify  prioritize  and answer the most important questions where analytics  statistical and ML modeling will have a material impact
Drive cross functional analytic projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams  frame and structure questions  collect and analyze data  summarize and present key insights in support of decision making
Work with engineers to evangelize data best practices and implement analytics solutions
Develop  train  and deploy ML models serving predictions and automating business processes
Collaborate with business leaders  subject matter experts  and decision makers to develop success criteria and optimize new products  features  policies  and models
Communicate key results with self-serve tools (dashboards  analytics tools) for leadership and product management
Develop anomaly detection  and data modelling tools to monitor key performance indicators to improve the efficiency of the products
Design experiments for product teams to test hypothesis and help with idea generation and refinement
Build key datasets and data pipelines using SQL/Python/ETL frameworks

Requirements

PhD or Masters degree in Statistics  Computer Science  Physical Sciences  Economics  Math or a related technical field
5+ years industry experience in data science or analytics
A consistent track record of performing data analysis using Python  R  and/or SQL
Experience using statistics and predictive analytics to solve complex business problems
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Familiarity with other data tools such as Druid  Hadoop  Tableau  Superset is a plus

FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion  connecting creators  curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good  bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people  our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences  empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives  creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.

OPERATIONS

We're passionate about operational excellence  acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey  we create our online content  secure payments and fraud process compliance  ensure order fulfilment and delivery  while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell  we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city  known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. From Account Management to Technology and Product  whatever your skills are  you'll find your fit here. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano in your lunch break!

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Senior Logistics Planning Manager  you will design processes and tools that support and automate existing forecasting processes. You will also simulate  predict and enable visibility on how the Customer-facing Algorithms are performing. You will be essential to ensure understanding between operational/commercial decisions and product roadmap  and to build the requirements that translate business decisions into product details. You will be a key asset in a better understanding on how profitability will be impacted by Customer-facing Algorithms decisions  and will ensure all teams are aligned with the our goals.

What You'll Do
You will work with the Product Team to maintain a simulation tool to provide business visibility on how Customer-facing Algorithms are performing.
Work with the product teams to build an wider long-term vision on the broader impacts of the several customer-facing algorithms interactions. Building a clearer vision on the wider impacts on changing behaviors will have within the several different algorithms.
Working with Logistics Planning Manager  will help build and follow metrics to measure impacts on Customer-facing Algorithms changes. Helping improve profitability as the main driver.
Who You Are
BA or BS in Engineering  Mathematics  Economics  Statistics  Computer Science or another technical field;
+2 years of experience in data analysis.
Experienced with SQL  BigQuery  Python is valued;
Experienced with reporting tools: Tableau and Looker;
Ability to identify solutions to problems and opportunities by analyzing data;
Project management;
With a commercial mindset;
Able to work in a fast moving operational environment;
Marketplace and e-commerce experience are valued;
Fluent in English.
Rewards & Benefits
Health insurance for the whole family  flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off  sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program
FARFETCH Equity plan

We continue to build our consciously inclusive culture as part of our Positively FARFETCH strategy throughout our business  partnerships and communities.

Indie Campers is your go-to marketplace for road trips. Aggregating over 2.000 own vehicles plus the campervans  motorhomes and other recreational vehicles of countless individual and professional hosts  we operate across 14 European countries - Germany  France  UK  Ireland  Spain  Italy  Switzerland  Austria  Netherlands  Belgium  Sweden  Portugal  Croatia and Iceland - and are physically present in over 40 cities.

Founded in 2013 by 2 good friends  Indie Campers has set its mission on democratizing road trips by enhancing travel experiences and lowering prices for millions of travellers worldwide. We envision becoming the world's no. 1 road trip provider and are quickly expanding - vertically and geographically - to make it happen on a daily basis.With a deep technological focus and foundation  our challenges are both exciting and demanding  and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and hopping on an ever-developing journey.

Revenue

The Indie Campers Revenue team works across the user lifecycle to develop a compelling global marketplace and community around road trips. We employ data and insights to help us best acquire  engage  serve  monetise and retain travellers and hosts across all of our territories to ensure that our customers are able to go on amazing road trips around the world. The Revenue team consists of our Customer Excellence  Marketing  Supply  Revenue Management and Data teams  so the work you do will depend on your particular blend of skills but will always be customer-centric  data-driven and collaborative as we work on increasing customer choice  value and satisfaction. If you are someone who wants to be part of an exciting multi-cultural  high-growth business and is able to bring their drive and ownership to creating incredible experiences for our customers  we want to hear from you.

Lisbon

Our Lisbon office is located in the city centre  known for its beautiful landscape  history and vibrant cultural scene. It is a place where our Product and Technology  Operations and Revenue teams meet informally  co-create together  have fun during lunch and enjoy our lovely barbecues at our terrace.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Indie Campers  you will work alongside a talented group of Analysts  Domain Experts  and business stakeholders to capture and structure our data  deliver insights and drive data-driven decision making.

What you will do:
Engage with key stakeholders to understand the business vision  requirements & priorities and help to translate data into actionable insights
Refine  challenge and support requests from stakeholders and create or adopt reports accordingly
Develop accessible  creative and engaging data visualisation and reports to facilitate access to insights
Analyse trends in our data and provide insight and explanation to different business units
Help identify  define and specify future analysis and data points that arise from new features or business processes
Collaborate with other data analysts  engineers and product owners

Who you are:
2+ years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar Growth-focused Analytical role
Fluent in English (mandatory)
Knowledge of developing end-to-end data pipelines  ETL / ELT processes and experience of working with structured and unstructured data
Comfortable utilising data visualisation platforms  particularly Tableau
Proficient in structured analysis and query optimisation in SQL
Experience in task management and knowledge management tools like JIRA / Confluence / Asana
Knowledge of Performance Marketing (Preferred but not required)
Knowledge of tools like Google analytics and Google Ads (Preferred but not required)
Demonstrable experience in turning data analytics into actionable insights and communicating these across multiple stakeholders
Commercial mindset with an ability to prioritise for results
Can-do attitude  high energy and ability to work autonomously
Outstanding at solving complex problems that require logical reasoning and good intuition
Able to work in a highly dynamic and international environment
Superb communication and relationship building skills

What we offer:
A dynamic position in a young  fast-growing and innovative company
Continuous training and coaching to develop your Analytical & Management skills
Competitive package including private health insurance  Indie Benefits and book free roadtrips European-wide (subject to availability)
International and informal work environment located in the heart of Lisbon.

A Adecco Recrutamento Especializado encontra-se a recrutar para cliente de referncia com atuao no setor da indstria e gesto de resduos  um Data Analyst (M/F) para integrar na sua equipa.

Funo

Analisar  monitorizar e providenciar orientaes para otimizar os dados registados nas plataformas informticas utilizadas pela empresa  permitindo garantir a fiabilidade dos dados de forma a facilitar a tomada de decises.

Principais Responsabilidades

 Anlise e tratamento de dados provenientes dos sistemas onde  registada toda a informao referente s operaes de gesto e colocao no mercado.

 Monitorizar e analisar os dados das diferentes reas da empresa  sistematizar informao e concluses  transformando os dados em informao de apoio  tomada de deciso estratgica.

 Contribuir ativamente  atravs de uma anlise crtica  com sugestes de melhoria do processo em pontos crticos identificados na anlise de dados.

 Realizar sesses de feedback contnuas  Direo Geral  rea de operaes e rea comercial e a toda a organizao transversalmente de forma a dar seguimento s concluses retiradas.

 Organizar os diferentes indicadores  relatrios e dashboards.

 Desenvolver as atividades no mbito das suas funes  de acordo com o Sistema da Qualidade da empresa.

Requisitos

 Licenciatura (pre-bolonha) ou mestrado em tecnologias da informao  estatstica  matemtica  gesto ou reas similares.

 Experincia profissional mnima de um ano na rea de anlise de dados.

 Domnio avanado de Excel. Conhecimentos de Power BI (preferencial).

 Conhecimentos de Ingls (fator obrigatrio).

 Capacidade de trabalhar com diferentes ferramentas e fontes de informao.

 Boa capacidade de anlise  rigor e sentido crtico.

 Boa capacidade de organizao e planeamento.

 Bom relacionamento interpessoal e de comunicao.

This position is under the Fast Track Programme.

What is the Fast Track Programme 21/22?

This programme has been developed to identify highly talented graduates  who are looking for a unique opportunity to start their career in a fast-paced  dynamic and digital environment  straight from University. The final candidates will join the team as Junior Analyst with a remunerated full-time agreement for 12 months (starting between January & February 2022).

During the Programme  your performance will be evaluated and reviewed. Top Performers will be promoted to a higher level and at the end will receive a job proposal to join the HQ team with a competitive remuneration and incentives package  subject to yearly promotion.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations  flights  and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings  our 4 000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity  creativity  and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership ?enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts  marketing strategists  and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science  product  strategy  and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data  creative ideas  and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role  youll get to:
Search: Experiment with text ads  bidding  and campaign structures on Google  Bing  Baidu  Naver  and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test  analyze  and optimize campaigns on Facebook  Twitter  Instagram  and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments  develop models we can use for optimization  and build dashboards for account managers
What youll Need to Succeed:
Bachelors Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science  mathematics  engineering  statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases  e.g.  SAS  R  SPSS  Python  VBA  SQL  Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills
Its Great if you Have:
Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations  flights  and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings  our 4 000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity  creativity  and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership ?enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts  marketing strategists  and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science  product  strategy  and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data  creative ideas  and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role  youll get to:
Search: Experiment with text ads  bidding  and campaign structures on Google  Bing  Baidu  Naver  and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test  analyze  and optimize campaigns on Facebook  Twitter  Instagram  and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments  develop models we can use for optimization  and build dashboards for account managers

Bachelors Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science  mathematics  engineering  statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases  e.g.  SAS  R  SPSS  Python  VBA  SQL  Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills
Its Great if you Have:
Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion  connecting creators  curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good  bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people  our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences  empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives  creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.

OPERATIONS

We're passionate about operational excellence  acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey  we create our online content  secure payments and fraud process compliance  ensure order fulfilment and delivery  while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell  we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city  known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. From Account Management to Technology and Product  whatever your skills are  you'll find your fit here. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano in your lunch break!

THE ROLE

We are looking for a Data Analyst  reporting to the Head of Customer Success  to be responsible for providing business reporting  strategic and tactical insights as well as key recommendations to measure  track and improve customer and partner experience.

What You'll Do
Use statistical methods to analyze data and create useful business reports
Help develop new KPIs & benchmarking to track and measure Partner and Customer Success
Analyze available data and produce recommendations based on insights to drive commercial success
Develop dashboards to present insights and in visually impactful way
Develop custom reporting via SQL and other BI tools to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership.
Build a reporting logic to produce analytical measures to tell the story of what is happening in the business;
Work with development team to scope out and implement new reports and tools as necessary;
Pull data from databases for own use or business owner use;
Manage data manipulation and provide scheduled reports.
Who You Are
A professional with a degree in Mathematics  Statistics or related field
Experience analyzing large amounts of data using Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and SQL (required)
Experienced in working with data presentation tools such as Tableau or Looker
You are able to present complex data clearly
Experienced in analytical tasks in one of the following areas: segmentation models  customer health  and retention & churn prediction (preferentially)
Fluent in English  both written and spoken
Rewards & Benefits
Health insurance for the whole family  flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off  sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program
FARFETCH Equity plan
EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT
FARFETCH is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We continue to build our consciously inclusive culture as part of our Positively FARFETCH strategy throughout our business  partnerships and communities.
You will need to use your data analysis expertise to support several projects and ad-hoc reporting requests and  using technical skills to follow up with Business Intelligence teams on the development of new reports.

About {Carpe Data

We are a dedicated group of data and industry experts that has our sights set on supporting transformation in the insurance industry. Carpe Data harnesses the power of emerging and alternative data for insurance carriers around the globe. Through access to continuous monitoring and predictive scoring  insurers gain deeper insight into risks in real-time which can significantly enhance many aspects of the insurance life cycle including underwriting  claims  and book assessment.

All Carpe Data employees are currently working on a hybrid approach due to the COVID-19 pandemic with plans to continue to do so until around November 2021. Candidates must be located in Lisbon or willing to relocate to Lisbon once our office reopens.

What you Will Do

As a Senior Data Analyst for Carpe Data  you will have the opportunity to test and refine our data products while conducting research to improve how data quality is measured and tracked over time. You will work closely with other data analysts and in collaboration with the development team. In this role  you will have the chance to exercise your creativity in an ETL process through iterative testing and analysis. You will have an opportunity to learn new skills in several areas  including Data Management  Data Science and Programming.

Responsibilities
Evaluate large datasets for dimensions such as quality  completeness and accuracy
Recognize patterns within our datastore
Write JIRA tickets to communicate requirements to developers
Determine product impact for data quality issues
Recommend creative approaches to structuring and manipulating new data within our internal data schema
Drive efficiency and automation throughout our Data Ingestion process
Augment existing data assessment techniques such as data profiling
Identify and suggest product and process improvements  including creating scripts to automate certain processes
Exploratory projects where you are given a broad hypothesis and are asked to arrive at a conclusion

Skills And Experience For Success In This Role
4 years experience with ETL processes and Big Data pipelines
Detail-oriented  analytical  and patient
SQL expert
Experience in large dataset assessments
Thorough understanding of all complex data types - structs  arrays  etc
Self-motivated to explore and undertake new projects
Familiarity with any of the following technologies is a plus: Excel  Kibana  Tableau  Snowflake  AWS tools  or like solutions
Command of at least one server side programming language. Ideally Python/Scala
Experience with orchestrated data pipelines is a plus
Experience managing data teams is a plus
Statistics  Math or Engineering relevant coursework is preferred  but all majors are welcome to apply

Why Carpe Data?

We are proud of our commitment to employee development--encouraging opportunities for growth across the organization. We have a strong focus on a collaborative company culture emphasizing teamwork and open communication. We actively strive to create a work environment  fostered by all employees  that provides equal and equitable access to opportunities  develops our people to acquire new skills and/or achieve personal and professional goals  and leverages all perspectives so that everyone feels welcome and valued and can contribute fully to our organizations success. We embrace our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives to show up as their authentic selves.

We Offer:
Competitive salary based on experience
100% employer covered health  vision and dental insurance
Monthly Food Stipend
Monthly Transportation allowance
22 days of paid vacation
Career-based training

Remote Work flexibility
Virtual company culture events such Yoga  Lunch & Learns  Social Justice Book Club  and Annual Hackathon
Office perks including stocked snack kitchen including fresh fruit  coffee  juice and snacks  standing desks  and a dog friendly environment

About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade  Kraken has risen to become one of the largest  most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank  providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter.

Our diverse group of 2 400+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture  united by a shared passion for delighting customers  upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve  are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential.

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and were just getting started. Were growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About The Role

This is a fully remote role  we will consider applicants based in North America  South America and Europe.

We are looking for a Growth Data Scientist who is innovative  highly-motivated  proactive and most of all  has a proven track record of success implementing growth analytics.

For this role  you will be part of a team that builds cutting-edge trading products in the cryptocurrency industry. You will be responsible for transforming data and generating actionable insights into our customer behavior and measuring the performance of Krakens growth.

You will collaborate and lead projects with product management  engineering  marketing  and growth teams. You will transform data from complex systems  generate performance metrics  and share the results with stakeholders at all levels of the company.

Great benefits  amazing perks  remote work  stock incentives  and a flexible PTO policy make Kraken a great place to work.

Responsibilities

Assess growth efforts across the organization by partnering with product  engineering  marketing  finance and other relevant stakeholders to identify  prioritize  and answer the most important questions
Evaluate performance of push  email  in-app messaging and paid media for acquisition and retargeting efforts  subscription  feature and content-led marketing through analysis of A/B test results and funnel analysis
Drive cross functional analytic projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams  frame and structure questions  collect and analyze data  summarize and present key insights in support of decision making
Develop  train  and deploy ML models serving predictions and automating business processes
Lead and develop analytics to track performance of marketing campaigns from pre-launch to post-launch  including forecasting  tracking KPIs across all marketing channels and performing deep dive analyses to gain insights to optimize performance
Identify subscription growth and retention opportunities through market attribution modeling and customer segmentation
Communicate key results with self-serve tools (dashboards  analytics tools) for leadership and product management.
Perform churn  retention and acquisition analyses across growth marketing initiatives using tools such as SQL  Python  and Tableau
Contribute to both the design of tests as well as the engineering of automated data pipelines using Airflow to power the measurement and performance of onboarding and retention tests

Requirements

PhD or Masters degree in Statistics  Computer Science  Physical Sciences  Economics  Math or a related technical field
5+ years industry experience in growth data science or analytics
A consistent track record of performing data analysis using Python  R  and/or SQL
Experience using statistics and predictive analytics to solve complex business problems
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Familiarity with other data tools such as Druid  Hadoop  Tableau  Superset is a plus

Ready to lead  disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry?

We are Emma  The Sleep Company. One of Europe's fastest-growing startups  we are now the world's leading D2C sleep brand. In 2020 our revenue grew from 150 to 405 million. We're pushing the boundaries of technology to transform the world of sleep. And we want your help to pull it off.

But Emma isn't for everyone. We're a highly ambitious  hard-working team that pushes you to produce your best work yet. We don't want average  we want high-performers who chase growth and set ambitious goals. Want your ideas to have impact and your career to grow? Then Emma is the right place for you.

What You'll Do
You will support the Order Management Team in managing the entire customer order fulfillment cycle  through reports and analytics.
You will conduct analytics and develop insights and recommend actions to optimize the Order to Cash workstream.
You will develop tech- and analytics powered solutions to improve the monitoring and steering of our order fulfillment KPI's.
You will help us connect the dots within the Emma Supply Chain Teams and Customer Excellence that will drive cost savings  process efficiency  perfect order fulfillment  and customer satisfaction.
What You'll Bring To Us
You have a degree in economics  business informatics  computer science  mathematics or a related field.
You are experienced in data analysis using appropriate tools and methods (SQL  Tableau  Python  etc.).
BI background and/or experience as a Supply Chain and Order Management data analyst is an advantage.
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to derive business actions from data.
Logical  analytical approach to problems as well as detail orientation and structuredness characterize you.
What We Offer
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and to create an impact with new  innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international team.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of a team with a non-hierarchical and non-political mindset; one team  one dream!
Become an Emmie

At Emma  you'll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to lead  disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry. Ready to work hard and help us get there? Directly apply through our application portal and become part of our exceptional team.

Mystic Ocean is a new ocean cruise company based in Portugal  that offers cruises along iconic destinations such as Mediterranean  Baltic and North Seas. Job Description

The Operational IT Data Analyst will be fully responsible for the integrity and data quality and ensures that it is always updated and ready for operational use. To ensure this  the Operational IT Data Analyst will be responsible for:
Ensure the used systems data lists and details are always up to date.
Upload and set documents ready with SQL merge scripts for operational team to use.
Maintain all the information in the database up to the latest information.
Support other department setting up documents  views  lists and scripts for an efficient productive work atmosphere.
Regularly clean and purge the system of all out of date non confidential information.
Create automated dashboards to measure KPIs and perform data validation to support operation.
Custom reporting with SQL and BI tool to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership.
Business cases to support decision and prioritizations.
Work with the product team to implement data collection and cleansing projects to build data structures.
Work with product team on systems integration projects.
Qualifications
Advanced SQL knowledge. Able to write advanced SQL scripts  to enhance the functionality of used systems.
Higher education in Information Management or Informatics  Informatics Engineering or Computer Science  or a relevant technical course in the area.
1-3 years experience in similar roles.
General knowledge of IT solutions for the development or integration of database systems  structured networks and communications in virtualized environments on Windows or Linux platforms.
General knowledge of infrastructure and service security.
Very good spoken and written English. With Good communication skills.
Must have good organizational skills and show attention to detail.
Must have initiative and the ability to work fully independent.
Must be able to remain calm under pressure.
Must be service minded with an outgoing and friendly personality.

About The Job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions  government agencies  and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products  you come in to facilitate making their work more productive  mobile  and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

With companies relying on Google Cloud  we regularly answer questions about technical features  helping customers design architectures  engage in proof of concepts  and troubleshooting potential roadblocks related to database migration and data backends.

As a Customer Engineer for Data Analytics  you'll utilize both your technical aptitude and exemplary communication to address all aspects of the data lifecycle.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure  platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Googles cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs  giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Support local Sales teams in pursuit of key business opportunities  engaging customers to address aspects of the data lifecycle.
Identify business and technical requirements  conduct full technical discovery  and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Lead technical projects  including such activities as technology advocacy  supporting bid responses  product and solution briefings  proof-of-concept work  and the coordination of supporting technical resources.

Were looking for a candidate with 3+ years experience in a previous Data Analytics role to join our newly formed team of Analytics experts coving all its data & insights needs for Romanian  Portuguese and Bulgarian markets. The hire will be expected to turn numbers into compelling stories and show strong leadership to drive decisions based on your insights. The main the goal is to identify streams of growth among different categories  paying users or markets and recommend actions that would lead to a sustainable growth on the short and long term.

What responsibilities will you get when working with us?
Proactively identifying and looking for answers of key strategic business questions around monetization and category management such as limits  portfolio of products  pricing and introduction of new product features  by developing appropriate models  algorithms  reports  dashboards and/or business analytical intelligence tools.
Creating value for the markets by providing actionable understanding of paying users and their behavior and by providing clear insights on how the business is evolving per category and market.
Partnering with key stakeholders  including the category managers  supporting their requests and coordinating actions with them and the other areas involved in the business process  delivering as best as possible actionable  updated and automated information.
Connecting the dots by synthesizing data from various sources.
Compiling the data in a compelling and easy to read format to be consumed by your main stakeholders.
Cooperating on a daily basis with other analysts within the team  in other operations and in product  to ensure proper impact measurement and a harmonized approach to the metrics used.
Verifying the consistency of data and KPI's of a comparison of reports  which allow the credibility of the data  report data inconsistencies to the operation for its improvement.
Continuously improve our data and BI operation  up to the best practices  maintaining current and innovative practices.
What will you need to be successful in this role?
Has meaningful analytical experience (preferably but not necessarily in web or mobile analytics).
Has profound knowledge of SQL and likes it (can be PL-SQL  MS-SQL  MySQL  PostgreSQL or any other dialect).
Is familiar with data visualization tools and can turn quantitative insights into a story (previous experience with Tableau appreciated).
Is able to define key metrics to optimize.
Is curious by nature  you dont need to know it all but are keen to explore and learn.
Can effectively deal with ambiguity and make good use of critical thinking
Is able to turn loads of data and numbers into meaningful and digestible stories  explaining the "why" behind the "what".
Is self-motivated and comfortable working hands-on - not minding to roll up your sleeves and get dirty.
Experienced in use of analytical tools (Excel a must  bonus if you worked with Python  R and/or other).
Previous experience with pricing and monetization projects is a plus.
What can we offer you?
Outstanding opportunity to become a part of an international team of committed people learning from one another and contributing to the OLX success.
Great place to learn and develop within fast-growing  global classifieds leader which opens further career opportunities in diverse world of OLX Europe.
Fun and informal environment where getting stuff done and enjoying the ride is far more important than rules and hierarchies.
We are curious  results-oriented and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise  experiment and push each other further  embracing uncertainty and inspiring change.
Solid basic salary and yearly bonus plus benefits!
Please attach a CV in English!

If youre ambitious  love food  and want to be part of a growing company filled with opportunities  keep reading.

Since 2014  we've created the global brands Marley Spoon (Martha Stewart & Marley Spoon in the US) and Dinnerly to deliver meal kits with unique  easy-to-cook recipes and top-quality  pre-portioned ingredients. And bezzie  our dog food brand  caters to our four-legged friends too.

From day one  youll have the autonomy to use your initiative to bring your ideas to life  inspire your team members  and keep learning. Because we know that when you grow  we grow. Youll own your role and have a lot on your plate  but youll be part of a stellar team that will support you along the way. And at the start of every day  youll feel proud and motivated to work for a better  more sustainable way to shop  cook  and eat.

The Culinary team is responsible for the recipes & menus creation based on our customers requirements and preferences. The recipes are the heart of Marley Spoon and are carefully and fully developed and tested in-house by our team.

We aim to consistently bring delicious and inspirational cooking into the kitchens of people  while preventing food waste. By understanding our customers we create and share quick  easy and wholesome recipes.

Our Sourcing team works on bringing the best & freshest ingredients to customers by purchasing directly from the source and local smaller producers. We source responsibly and assure full traceability of all goods. Marley Spoon grows together with its partners and builds long-term relationships via information sharing  storytelling  focus on sustainability and joint business planning.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to be part of our Culinary and Sourcing teams in Europe. This role is meant to support Culinary and Sourcing to have access to the data and insights we need to make quick and smart decisions.

The role & responsibilities:
Performing ad hoc analyses within ingredient  recipe and menu topics through collecting  preparing  visualizing  and examining trends in large data sets to deliver insights and recommendations to business stakeholders
Building reports and dashboards to monitor ongoing culinary and sourcing KPIs
Collaborating with other teams on cross-departmental projects
Supporting the global culinary and sourcing teams by responding to data requests and assisting with process optimisation
Implementing automation solutions on data and reporting

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative subject: Mathematics/Statistics  Economics  Finance  or any other related field of study
3+ years of experience in similar analytics role
Outstanding analytical skills with the ability to collect  organize  analyze  and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and a critical thinking approach
Intermediate/advanced knowledge of SQL and/or at least one scripting language (e.g. Python or R)
Advanced knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets  familiarity with Google Suite and MS Office  and capability to quickly adapt to using new tools
Knowledge of a BI platform (e.g. Looker) is a plus
Team player with good communication and storytelling skills
Fluent in English. German speaking is a plus

Benefits
Being part of a profitable company in a full-blown scale-up phase  offering immense opportunities for personal & career growth
The opportunity to help shape the vision and direction of Culinary at Marley Spoon
Flexible working hours (hybrid mode: home + office hours split)
5% of your working time on personal learning and development
A new and modern office within the heart of Lisbon
Friday drinks and many after-work events (more online these days)
An open  diverse and respectful culture with over 50 nationalities
Windows or Apple equipment (depending on preference)

Support and coordinate testing activities across all phases of projects including unit testing  integration testing  user acceptance testing and downstream testing.

Experience of working across Agile scrum or Kanban projects

Stakeholder management by supporting the business in delivering its objectives
Innovation and creation of new products and tools.
Full project lifecycle experience  from initial concept through to deployment and support.
Fluent in English

Must be a spanish citizen or have a work permit for Spain
Experience In Following Is a Plus

Fluency in Portuguese  Spanish or French

Curiosity: You should always be curious to ask the Why questions from the business and how from the development team
